key_events.description: Dividend of BRL 0.88 per share was paid on January 15, 2026; ex-dividend date was January 1, 2026.
XP projects a dividend yield of 13.3% for the next 12 months.
XPCI11 quote started the year at R$82.91 and is currently at R$85.89.

risk_factors: Higher market quote volatility compared to peers

investment_thesis.bull_case: Buy recommendation based on efficient management, low-risk credit portfolio, attractive trading price (VM/VP of 0.88x), and a yield of IPCA + 9.60% p.a.
investment_thesis.bear_case: Risks include unfavorable judicial decisions, systemic real estate sector risks, lower liquidity, and higher market quote volatility.

summary_markdown: XPCI11 distributed a dividend of BRL 0.88 per share in January 2026. The current dividend yield is around 12.28%-12.57%. XP projects a dividend yield of 13.3% for the next 12 months. The fund has 86.6% of its assets allocated in 45 CRIs and 11.5% in FIIs. The portfolio is predominantly concentrated in assets linked to inflation, which represent 85% of the total and have an average market rate (MTM) of IPCA + 8.22% per year. The P/VP ratio is 0.94. The XPCI11 quote started the year trading at R$82.91 and today is at R$85.89.
